review: I purchased the Chromecast recently after reading all the reviews that raved about how this was a "life changing" device.  I can see where it has the potential to make things much more convenient, but I have yet to really have a positive experience.I have used the Chromecast to interface with both my iPhone and my laptop and it seems to work better with my iPhone.  Buffering is the main problem with video.  If I attempt to stream netflix to the Chromecast device from either my laptop or iPhone, the buffering will downright drive you crazy.  Streaming from a browser? Forget it.  The Chromecast will eventually time out and just stop casting.Admittedly, some of this may be due to my lower-tier internet connection.  I do understand that this may be a bandwidth-heavy device to use, but I do stream netflix through my Xbox 360 with very satisfactory results on a regular basis.  In addition to that, there are much more streaming options readily available through my Xbox that the Chromecast doesn't support as of this review (Vudu, Hulu, etc...)To sum up, this device could be promising but falls short to replace my normal streaming strategies.
